modules.description: Provides functions to create input sources from files, strings, bytes, and input channels, as well as custom inputs defined by low-level operations. Works with file paths, strings, byte arrays, and input channels, and supports custom input implementations via seek, read, and line offset functions. Used to handle text input in parsing and formatting tasks, particularly when tracking positions and line numbers is required.

Provides functions to create and manipulate positions based on byte offsets, line numbers, and columns. Works with integer line and column values, byte offsets, and Lexing.position structures. Converts between internal positions and Lexing positions, and calculates offsets within an input source.

Provides functions to track and report errors with location information, including retrieving and formatting source code fragments around specific positions. Works with file positions, ranges, and source text to generate highlighted error messages. Used in parsers and compilers to display precise error contexts to users.

handles input sources and position tracking, enabling precise control over text processing and output formatting. It defines input sources with seek, read, and line offset capabilities, and position types based on byte offsets, lines, and columns. Functions convert between internal and Lexing positions, and track offsets within inputs. It integrates with output customization by providing context for highlighting specific parts of the text.
